{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3527091,"name":"Ethan C","username":"ethanc8","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T16:18:24.024Z","cooked":"

I have just updated my installation script to install WPILib 2025.3.1.

It can:

  • Install WPILib
  • Install the WPILib vscode extension into your main VSCode installation or into a VSCode fork such as VSCodium or one of the AI-enabled vscode forks (AI-enabled vscode forks are not tested)
  • Add frccode2025 to your $PATH
  • Install OpenDS and add it to your $PATH and start menu/Launchpad/etc (creates a .app on macOS and .desktop on Linux)
  • Install PathPlanner and add it to your $PATH and start menu/Launchpad/etc (creates a .app on macOS and .desktop on Linux)

Sorry, I forgot to commit my changes. I just pushed. If you used the script in the last 5 hours, run the script again to upgrade from WPILib 2025.2.1 to 2025.3.1.
